content.description: A fun, slabby corner.  Climb past a low bolt, then up the corner, passing a small roof on the right.  Crack is initially very thin; lots of tiny nuts are helpful.
content.protection: 1 bolt, lots of tiny nuts & cams, plus cams to a #3 Camalot.  Fixed rap anchor (soon to be improved) at the top.
content.location: Located about 35 yards sout of Yes We Can & 100 yards south of OST/RA.  Approach as for Supercrack Tower, but 50? yards before the turnoff to ST, turn left up a small drainage with a larg-ish scrub oak.  Scramble up the large slope on the south side of the drainage to the cliffs, then contour right to the base of the obvious slabby corner.

content.description: A varied route up a long stem box.  Climb right crack in the stem box up intermittently great & not so great rock.  Up high, grovel through a short offwidth/chimney to a nice clean, steep, thin hands corner.  Rap off a fixed anchor of a tree & fixed chockstone.
content.protection: Nuts & double cams up to #3 camalot, 1 #4.  A couple extra small-med cams might be nice, and save a .75 for up high.
content.location: Located 25 yards right of Yesterday's 5.8, and 75 yards south of OST/RA.  Approach as for Supercrack Tower, but 50? yards before the turnoff to ST, turn left up a small drainage with a larg-ish scrub oak. Scramble up the large slope on the south side of the drainage to the cliffs, then contour right to the climb.

content.description: Mostly liebacking, some ow & chimney too.
content.protection: if you had enough big bros, maybe.... but because of the expanding nature of the flake it's best left as a top rope.
content.location: N/NW of SCT is a giant triangular flake

content.description: Start a flared chimney w/ difficult exit then up steep hand cracks in flare then steep finger cracks-- 3 cruxes!!!
content.protection: double set to #4, triple #2's may be useful.

content.description: Follow bolts past some reachy moves on buckets, then up and left on small edges & underclings.
content.location: Left-arcing line of bolts 30' right of 'Yesterdays 5.8'

content.description: towering sandstone cliffs at the top of wilson canyon and below the mountain top basalt crags.    Very crowded, windy, too hot or too cold- you really wouldn't want to climb there...
